name: Miller, Appellant, v. Erie County Court of Common Pleas
name_abbreviation: Miller v. Erie County Court of Common Pleas

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
parties: Miller, Appellant, v. Erie County Court of Common Pleas.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The order of the court below discharging the rule to show cause why a writ of habeas corpus should not be issued is affirmed upon the opinion of Judge Laub.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: William F. Miller, appellant, in propria persona.
Damian J. McLaughlin, District Attorney, and Paul B. Joslin, Assistant District Attorney, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Miller, Appellant, v. Erie County Court of Common Pleas.
Submitted March 25, 1947.
Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
William F. Miller, appellant, in propria persona.
Damian J. McLaughlin, District Attorney, and Paul B. Joslin, Assistant District Attorney, for appellee.
April 14, 1947:
